title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Darren confronts Mandy ahead of stunt after DJ discovery
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Darren Osbourne (Ashley Taylor Dawson) had everything he could want in Hollyoaks, what with Mandy Richardson (Sarah Jayne Dunn) by his side and baby DJ in his life. However, his world came crashing down last week when he made the shocking discovery that DJ isn’t actually his child, but rather he’s actually Luke Morgan’s (Gary Lucy). Tonight, he sets about confronting Mandy with his discovery.

Baby DJ’s christening arrived during the latest episode, and Darren and Mandy were on cloud nine. Darren had invited Luke to the ceremony, but — unbeknown to him — Luke was harbouring a big secret, after Ollie (Aedan Duckworth) had revealed to him that he was in fact DJ’s father, and not Darren.

Ollie was hellbent on tracking Luke down but, little did he know Luke was at the christening. As Luke pondered what to do for the best, he ultimately decided against revealing the truth as he didn’t want to break-up the family, but — as he held the child in his arms — he talked about how he was going to give up the chance to be a dad to him so that he could have a proper family with Mandy and Darren.

However, unbeknown to Luke, Darren was outside the church and overheard everything.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Tonight, Darren disappears and Mandy searches high and low to try and track him down. However, it comes to light that he’s been staying with Nancy (Jessica Fox) and Kyle (Adam Rickitt) — something which leaves Kyle questioning why Nancy’s being so friendly towards her ex.

Later, Darren takes it upon himself to confront Mandy with his discovery, and claims that she knew he wasn’t DJ’s father this whole time. Mandy is stunned by what Darren has to say, and promises him that this is the first she’s heard of it.

Will Mandy and Darren be able to get through this together? Or will Darren struggle to come to terms with the fact the isn’t DJ’s biological dad?

What’s more, with a big stunt week ahead, could Mandy or Darren find themselves in danger before they get to talk things through?

Hollyoaks kicks off its huge stunt week tonight at 7pm on E4.
